result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Willie C McDaniels

records.addlTxt: Defendant waives his right to a Preliminary Hearing.

9:29 AM Defendant Willie C McDaniels in court.  Attorney Steven Hughes in court for Willie C McDaniels.  Prosecuting attorney Charles Patrick Hoffmann in court for the State of Wisconsin. 

The Court finds that the Defendant's waiver to a preliminary hearing is knowing and voluntary. 
Waive reading of Information. 
NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.
Hearing scheduled for December 2, 2022 at 09:30 am.
To Seal Victim/Witness Identification Key. Signed by Judge Paul F. Reilly on 9/29/22.
Defendant's Demand for Discovery and Inspection.
records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Preliminary hearing on October 31, 2022 at 09:15 am.

Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing. Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed. Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia. Defendant to have no contact with Neu's Hardware Store listed in the Criminal Complaint. Defendant is ordered to report to the Criminal Traffic Division by 4:00 PM on 10/05/2022 to sign their bond. Failure to do so shall result in the Court issuing a bench warrant.

8:47 AM Defendant Willie C McDaniels appeared by Zoom.  Attorney Steven Hughes in court for Willie C McDaniels.  Prosecuting attorney Lindsey Hirt in court for the State of Wisconsin. All parties have agreed that some may have the hearing conducted remotely. This hearing has met the statutory standards for video conferencing. Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint. Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties. Preliminary Hearing requested. Preliminary time limits waived.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 31, 2022 at 09:15 am.
Victim/Witness Identification Key filed, under seal, by the District Attorney's office.
State's Demand for Discovery and Inspection and Notice of Intent to Use Defendant's Statement and DNA Evidence.
